definition: back to where we were (idiom); absolutely no improvement/Things haven't changed at all.
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of

sentences.english: Never ask me whether the changeable world will still be what it is tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要問，善變的世界明天是否依然如故。

sentences.english: How does a grown woman thank for a mother for continuing to be a mother?
sentences.chinese: 一個成年女子該怎樣感謝母親依然如故的角色？

sentences.english: But the misery of life back in their home town is never far away.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們家鄉的苦難生活卻依然如故。

sentences.english: But it still firmly lying there, remain unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 可它仍然穩穩地靜臥在那裏，依然如故。
時至今日，這些聚居區依然如故。

sentences.english: Today the time-honored elegance still pervades it.
sentences.chinese: 今天，瀰漫其間的優雅風姿依然如故。

definition: to be one's old self (idiom)/to be unchanged/(derog.) to be stuck in one's ways
as before/as usual/(to be) like old friends
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
no matter what/despite/to allow (sb to act arbitrarily)
